Crimes.Crime_Name: Marriage Fraud under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Genuineness of marriage for immigration purposes
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR)
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Wife provided vague answers, lacked credibility on key points including intentions and finances
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Large financial transfers prior to meeting, quick marriage, limited interaction, lack of intent to cohabit in Canada
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to IAD's factual findings
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Marriage must be genuine and not entered into primarily for immigration benefit
Crimes.Application_Factor: Timing of marriage, financial support, age difference, credibility
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Sponsorship application refused due to suspected marriage fraud
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the IAD unreasonably concluded the marriage was not genuine
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPR requirements for genuine marital relationships
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: No question certified; judicial intervention not warranted
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections of IRPR related to spousal sponsorship and genuineness of marriage
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of detailed knowledge between spouses
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process followed IAD procedures for assessing credibility and evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Wife’s vague responses about relationship and financial matters
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of IAD’s conclusion
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review in judicial review of administrative decisions

Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Genuineness of marriage and intent to misrepresent for immigration benefit
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of IRPA
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Wife’s testimony lacked detail and consistency, raising doubts about authenticity
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Financial transactions, timeline of relationship, testimonial inconsistencies
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage not genuine and intended to obtain immigration status
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Financial support before meeting, short courtship, credibility concerns
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Misrepresentation under IRPA involving false or deceptive practices
Crimes.Application_Factor: Duration of relationship, financial behavior, age gap, credibility of statements
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Application refused due to doubts about marriage genuineness
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the IAD unreasonably found misrepresentation based on marriage fraud
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA provisions on misrepresentation and admissibility
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Doubts about the authenticity of the marriage
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Tribunal conducted hearing with opportunity to present evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Vague and implausible explanations from the sponsored spouse
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that IAD’s conclusion was unreasonable
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Scope of judicial review over administrative tribunals
